name: themes
description: Check if it possible to change Chrome Theme
pre_condition: Have Chrome Started on the main page (applications tab)

steps.description: Click on "Chrome Web Store"
steps.expected: The Chrome Web Store is displayed

steps.description: On the left frame, Click on "Themes"
steps.expected: A lot of Themes are displayed

steps.description: Select one and click on "Choose Theme"
steps.expected: The theme is installed by Chrome and applied to Chrome browser

author: elebideau

name: default-themes
description: The theme can be reset to default google chrome themes
pre_condition: change the theme using Chrome web store

steps.description: open settings
in "Appearance" section, click on "Use GTK+ Theme"
steps.expected: the apperance must be reset to the original one

author: sdx

name: startup-specific
pre_condition: Have Chrome started with several tabs opened

steps.description: Click on the Tools button
steps.expected: A drop-down menu opens

steps.description: Click on "Settings"
steps.expected: A new "Settings" tab opens

steps.description: In this tab, At the "On startup" level, select "Continue where I left off" and close Chrome
Start Chrome again
steps.expected: The tabs opened before quitting have been restored

steps.description: Still in the "On startup" level, Selec "Open a specific page or set of pages" and click on "Set pages"
steps.expected: A "Startup pages" window appears"

steps.description: In this window, Add "www.youyube.com" in the "Add a new page file" field and press "Enter"
Add "www.facebook.com" in the "Add a new page file" field and press "Enter"
Click on "Ok" and close Chrome
Start Chrome again
steps.expected: Chrome starts with the Youtube and the Facebook pages displayed

author: elebideau

name: home-button
description: define the url corresponding to the Home button and display it in Chrome

steps.description: Click on the Tools button
steps.expected: A drop-down menu opens

steps.description: Click on "Settings"
steps.expected: A new "Settings" tab opens

steps.description: In this tab, in the "Appearance" level, check "Show Home button"
steps.expected: The Home button is displayed in Chrome

steps.description: Under "Show Home button", click on "Change" next to "New tab page"
steps.expected: A "Home page" window appears

steps.description: In this window, check "Open this page" and type "www.wikipedia.org" in the field corresponding and press "Enter"
Click on "Ok"
Click on the Home button
steps.expected: The Wikipedia page is successfully displayed

author: elebideau

name: print-document
objective: print a document from google chrome
description: Check if Chrome handle the printing support for documents
pre_condition: Have a printer correctly installed and configured and have Google Drive started in Chrome and have imported a document in google drive

steps.description: Click on a document listed in Google Drive
steps.expected: The document is displayed

steps.description: Click on the bottom-right printing button
steps.expected: A printing page is displayed

steps.description: Click on Print
steps.expected: The printing manager starts and the document is correctly printed

author: elebideau

name: print-web-site
objective: print a web site from google chrome
description: Check if Chrome handle the printing support for websites
pre_condition: have Google chrome started with any website displayed

steps.description: Press Ctrl+P
steps.expected: A printing page is displayed

steps.description: Click on Print
steps.expected: The printing manager starts and the document is correctly printed

author: elebideau

name: secure-connection
objective: use secure connection by google chrome
description: Check if Chrome can use secure connection
pre_condition: Have a google account and have Google chrome started with the main "applications" page displayed

steps.description: Click on the "Gmail" icon
steps.expected: Gmail page is displayed and the mention "https" is visible in the beginning of the search bar

name: set-default
objective: Google Chrome as default Web Browser
description: Set Google Chrome as the default Browser used with the system

steps.description: Click on the top-right configuration button
steps.expected: A drop-down menu opens

steps.description: Click on "Settings"
steps.expected: A new Settings tab appears

steps.description: Down to this tab, select "Define Google Chrome as default browser"
steps.expected: Chrome is now the default browser of the system

name: default-browser
objective: every url link opened with google chrome
description: Check if a link is correctly opened with Google Chrome
pre_condition: Have an edited text file opened with an URL text in it

steps.description: Click on the link in the text file
steps.expected: Chrome starts and the page corresponding to the link is correctly opened

author: elebideau

name: html5-notifications
objective: HTML5 notifications displayed in Desktop environment notifications area
description: Check if HTML5 notifications are displayed in Dektop environment notifications area

steps.description: Open the following website : http://dangercove.com/html5-notifications/
Click on "Ask permission to display notifications"
steps.expected: Chrome ask you to Deny or Allow showing desktop notifications

steps.description: Click on "Allow"
In the bottom-left page, clik on "Show notification"
steps.expected: The notifications are displayed in the bottom screen and available in the bottom-right notifications area

author: elebideau

name: gnome-online-account
objective: use gnome online account to sign in google user
description: Sign in Chrome with the Gnome Online Account configured with a Google account
pre_condition: Have configured Gnome Online Account with a Google Account

steps.description: Start Google chrome without any count registered
steps.expected: Chrome should start normally, and the "Welcome to Chrome" page must not appears because your "sign in" parameters have been automatically registered in Chrome due to Gnome Online Account configuration

author: elebideau

name: save-username-password
objective: save a username and a password with chrome
description: Check if Chrome is able to save passwords
pre_condition: Have a google account and have chrome started with no user account registered

steps.description: Go on wwww.google.com
On that page, click on the top-right "Connexion" button
steps.expected: A Google account page appears

steps.description: In this page, fill the email and the password fields
Click on "Connexion"
steps.expected: The Google page appears with a top-notifications asking if Chrome has to save password or not

steps.description: Click on "Save password"
steps.expected: Your password has been successfully

steps.description: Disconnect from your Google account
Close Chrome and start it again
Click on "Connexion"
steps.expected: The email and the password fields are already filled and there is just need to click in "Connexion"

author: elebideau

name: gnome-keyring
objective: username and password saved in chrome are saved in gnome-keyring/seahorse
description: Check if the usernames and passwords saved in chrome are saved too in the Gnome configuration
pre_condition: Have registered your google account in Chrome

steps.description: In the homescreen application mode, click on the "Passwords and Keys" application
steps.expected: The application starts and must appears the line "accounts.google.com"

steps.description: Righ-click on this line and select "Properties"
steps.expected: A window appears with the key and Details tabs

steps.description: In the "Key" tab, click on Password in the bottom
steps.expected: A hide-password appears

steps.description: Check "Show password"
steps.expected: The Google account password must be displayed

steps.description: Click on the "Details" tab
steps.expected: At the "username_value" line should appears the Google account username

author: elebideau

name: set-proxy
objective: set a proxy in google chrome
description: Check if chrome is able to open the ConnMan proxy settings

steps.description: Click on the Tools button
steps.expected: A drop-down menu opens

steps.description: Click on "Settings"
steps.expected: A new "Settings" tab opens

steps.expected: More settings are available

steps.description: Go to the "Network" level and click on "Change proxy settings..."
steps.expected: The ConnMan Settings UI window appears and allows to set a proxy

name: system-title-bar
objective: Google chrome configured to use system title and border
description: Check if it is possible to enable/disable system title and border in chrome

steps.expected: A drop-down menu opens

author: elebideau

name: import-certificate
objective: Import secure certificate in google chrome
description: Check if chrome is able to import secure certificates
pre_condition: have Chrome started and have a certificate file in your home directory

steps.description: Click on the Tools button
steps.expected: A drop-down menu opens

steps.description: Click on "Settings"
steps.expected: A new "Settings" tab opens

steps.description: Go down of the page settings and click on "Show advanced settings..."
steps.expected: More settings are available

steps.description: Go to the "HTTP/SSL" level and click on "Manage certificates..."
steps.expected: A "Certificate manager" window appears with a "Your Certificates", a "Servers", a "Authorities", and a "Others" tab

steps.description: Select one of the tab and click on "Import..." in it
steps.expected: A file manager opens

steps.description: In the file manager select your certificate and click on "Open"
Back to the Certificate Manager, cick on "Ok"
steps.expected: The certificate has been succesfully imported
